metadata.case_name: West End Hotel Proprietors v. Corporation of the City of Bangalore

facts.text: Appellant company are proprietors of West End Hotel, Race Course Road, Bangalore. Premises total 19.43 acres or 11,19,168 sq. ft., building area 1,05,683 sq. ft. Entire vacant land excluding built area and appurtenant thereof used for beneficial enjoyment of building as garden and lawns.

Notice No. 4606 dated March 31, 1966 issued by Assistant Revenue Officer, Corporation of Bangalore, to appellant demanding Rs. 35,717.20 as tax on vacant land measuring 89,293 sq. yds. at 0.4% of market value plus cesses with effect from April 1, 1965.

High Court by judgment dated March 28, 1967 dismissed prayer for declaration of invalidity of s.99(2)(b) of Corporation Act as amended by 1964 Act, but quashed notice to extent relating to period anterior to date of notice.
Objections filed on behalf of appellant before the Commissioner.
Appellant filed Writ Petition No. 704 of 1966 under Art. 226 challenging s.99(2)(b) as unconstitutional.
Property tax also demanded on building of hotel, but High Court excluded contentions relating to property tax on buildings; appellant left to normal remedies.
Tax on lands was being levied before 1964 Act, either separately or as part of building.

legal_issues.text: Whether s.99(2)(b) of Corporation Act as amended by 1964 Act is beyond legislative competence of State Legislature.
Whether s.99(2)(b) violative of Arts. 14 and 19(1)(f) of Constitution.
Whether Corporation omitted to observe procedure in s.98 and cannot levy tax.

Whether tax on vacant land at 0.4% of market value discriminatory under Art.14: no relation to actual/potential income; discriminatory determination of market value; discriminatory classification of vacant land vs. appurtenant land.
Whether levy under s.99(2)(b) is a new tax requiring procedure under s.98.

petitioner_arguments.text: New provision s.99(2)(b) beyond legislative competence.
Tax levied at average rate without relation to actual/potential income; discriminatory determination of market value; classification of vacant vs. appurtenant land discriminatory.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Article 14; Kunnathat Thathunni Moopil Nair v. State of Kerala

petitioner_arguments.text: Expression 'estimated value' and 'area' vague for market value determination.
Distinction between land appurtenant up to 3x building area and excess is artificial.
This is a new tax requiring s.98 procedure.

court_reasoning.text: Point No.1 on legislative competence not pressed in view of Assistant Commissioner of Urban Land Tax v. Buckingham Carnatic Co.
Tax not discriminatory under Art.14: market value ascertained first, then 0.4% levied; Commissioner determines per s.99(3) looking at similarly situate lands.
court_reasoning.key_observation: 'Estimated value' and 'area' not vague; refers to locality and similar lands.

court_reasoning.text: Fixing at 0.4% not discriminatory; uniform rate on market value permissible; market value relates to actual/potential income.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Distinguishes Kunnathat Thathunni Moopil Nair (no income reference) and State of Kerala v. Haji K. Kutty (floor area basis).

court_reasoning.text: Classification of vacant/excess land vs. appurtenant up to 3x building area valid; excess use not in public interest where land scarce; 3x reasonable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Legislature can classify; no need to specify surplus land as in block.

court_reasoning.text: Not a new tax; property tax levied before 1964 Act on lands separately or as part of building; s.98 not applicable.

holdings.text: s.99(2)(b) not violative of Art.14; market value basis valid, uniform 0.4% rate permissible.
Classification under Explanation to s.99(2)(b) reasonable and non-discriminatory.
Levy not new tax; s.98 procedure not required.

precedents_cited.case_name: Assistant Commissioner of Urban Land Tax v. Buckingham Carnatic Co.
precedents_cited.relevance: Petitioner not pressing legislative competence point.

precedents_cited.case_name: Kunnathat Thathunni Moopil Nair v. State of Kerala
precedents_cited.relevance: Unlike here, no reference to income; hypothetical unequal burden.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Kerala v. Haji K. Kutty
precedents_cited.relevance: Floor area basis different from market value.

statutes_cited.name: City of Bangalore Municipal Corporation Act, 1949 (as amended by 1964 Act)
statutes_cited.relevance: Imposition and levy of property tax on lands at 0.4% market value; procedure; appurtenant land definition.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Equality; right to property (not available to company); writ jurisdiction.

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave dismissed; upheld validity of s.99(2)(b); rejected Art.14 challenge and s.98 procedure argument.

key_quotes.text: "We are unable to hold that the impugned Act is discriminatory."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects Art.14 challenge to tax levy.

key_quotes.text: "Market value of land always bears a definite relationship to the actual or potential income being derived or derivable from the land."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Justifies market value basis over income.

key_quotes.text: "Three times the area occupied by a building is not a small area and we are unable to hold that this figure is not reasonable."
key_quotes.speaker: court
